name: gns3-mcp
description: GNS3 lab automation - 27 tools + 19 resources (3 static + 16 templates) + 5 prompts with Docker node file operations
long_description:
COMPLETE MCP SERVER: 27 tools + 19 browsable resources + 5 workflow prompts + Docker node configuration.

KEY FEATURES:
• Docker Node File Operations: Read/write files in Docker containers, configure network interfaces
  - Tools: get_node_file(), write_node_file(), configure_node_network()
  - Supports: Network config (static/DHCP), multi-interface setup, automatic node restart
  - Use Cases: SSH proxy setup, custom container config, network troubleshooting
• Project Notes/Memory: Store IPs, credentials, and architecture in per-project README
  - Tools: get_project_readme(), update_project_readme()
  - Resource: gns3://projects/{id}/readme
• Template Usage Notes: Access device-specific default credentials and setup instructions
  - Resource: gns3://projects/{id}/nodes/{id}/template
• 27 Action Tools: Create nodes, configure devices, manage connections, Docker file ops
• 19 MCP Resources: Browse projects, nodes, sessions (3 static + 16 templates)
• 5 Workflow Prompts: Guided setup for SSH, topology discovery, troubleshooting

Version 0.25.0: Added Docker node file operations and network configuration. For complete docs see SKILL.md. Supports GNS3 v3 API.

gns3_host.title: GNS3 Server Host
gns3_host.description: GNS3 server hostname or IP address

tools.name: open_project
tools.description: Open a GNS3 project by name (returns JSON ProjectInfo)

tools.name: create_project
tools.description: Create a new GNS3 project and auto-open it (returns JSON ProjectInfo)

tools.name: close_project
tools.description: Close the currently opened project (returns JSON success message)

tools.name: set_node
tools.description: Configure node properties and/or control state (returns JSON status message)

tools.name: create_node
tools.description: Create a new node from template at specified coordinates (returns JSON NodeInfo)

tools.name: console_send
tools.description: Send data to console (auto-connects, returns status string)

tools.name: console_read
tools.description: Read console output with mode parameter (mode='diff'/'last_page'/'num_pages'/'all', supports grep filtering)

tools.name: console_disconnect
tools.description: Disconnect console session (returns JSON status)

tools.name: console_keystroke
tools.description: Send special keystroke to console (navigation, editing, control keys)

tools.name: console_send_and_wait
tools.description: Send command and wait for prompt pattern with timeout (pattern matching + auto-polling, returns JSON with output and timing)

tools.name: console_batch
tools.description: Execute multiple console operations in batch (send/send_and_wait/read/keystroke) with two-phase validation and full parameter support

tools.name: set_connection
tools.description: Batch manage network connections with two-phase validation (returns JSON OperationResult)

tools.name: delete_node
tools.description: Delete a node from the current project (returns JSON confirmation)

tools.name: get_node_file
tools.description: Read file from Docker node filesystem (returns JSON with file contents)

tools.name: write_node_file
tools.description: Write file to Docker node filesystem - requires manual node restart to apply changes (returns JSON confirmation)

tools.name: configure_node_network
tools.description: Configure network interfaces on Docker node with static IP or DHCP - automatically restarts node to apply (returns JSON with configured interfaces)

tools.name: create_snapshot
tools.description: Create a snapshot of the current project state (returns JSON SnapshotInfo)

tools.name: restore_snapshot
tools.description: Restore project to a previous snapshot state (returns JSON success message)

tools.name: get_project_readme
tools.description: Get project README/notes in markdown format - IP schemes, credentials, architecture notes (returns JSON with content)

tools.name: update_project_readme
tools.description: Update project README/notes - agent can store IP addresses, credentials, architecture diagrams, troubleshooting notes (returns JSON success)

tools.name: ssh_configure
tools.description: Configure SSH session with auto-recovery (30min TTL, health checks, auto-recreates stale sessions). After 'Socket is closed' error: just retry same call - no force needed. Requires SSH enabled on device first.

tools.name: ssh_command
tools.description: Execute SSH command(s) with auto-detection (string=show command, list=config commands)

tools.name: ssh_disconnect
tools.description: Disconnect SSH session (returns JSON status)

tools.name: export_topology_diagram
tools.description: Export topology diagram as SVG/PNG with optional crop region (returns JSON with file paths)

tools.name: create_drawing
tools.description: Create a drawing object - rectangle, ellipse, line, or text (returns JSON with drawing info)

tools.name: update_drawing
tools.description: Update properties of an existing drawing object (returns JSON with updated drawing)

tools.name: delete_drawing
tools.description: Delete a drawing object from the current project (returns JSON confirmation)

prompts.name: topology_discovery

prompts.text: Guided workflow for discovering and visualizing network topology using MCP resources and export tools

prompts.name: troubleshooting

prompts.text: OSI model-based systematic troubleshooting methodology for network lab issues

prompts.name: lab_setup

prompts.text: Automated lab topology creation supporting star, mesh, linear, ring, OSPF, and BGP topologies

prompts.name: node_setup
prompts.description: Node Setup Workflow - Complete workflow for adding a new node to a lab (create, configure IP, document in README, establish SSH)
